sen.j: 岡寺（おかでら）は、奈良県高市郡明日香村にある真言宗豊山派の寺院。
sen.e: Oka-dera Temple located in Asuka-mura, Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture is a temple of Shingo sect Buzan school.
Oka-dera Temple located in Asuka-mura, Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture is a temple of the Shingo sect Buzan school.
sen.cmt: the Shingo sect Buzan school としました。
sen.e: Oka-dera Temple located in Asuka-mura, Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture is a temple of the Shingo sect Buzan school.

sen.j: 山号は東光山、寺号は龍蓋寺（りゅうがいじ）とも称する。
sen.e: Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Mt. Tokozan, and jigo (literally, "temple name"), it is also called Ryugai-ji Temple as its jigo, the title given to a Buddhist temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Its sango (prefix of a Buddhist temple) is Toko-zan, and it is called Ryugai-ji Temple by another jigo (literally, "temple name"), the title given to a Buddhist temple.
sen.cmt: (prefix of a Buddhist temple) is Toko-zan, and it is called Ryugai-ji Temple by another jigoとしました。
sen.e: Its sango (prefix of a Buddhist temple) is Toko-zan, and it is called Ryugai-ji Temple by another jigo (literally, "temple name"), the title given to a Buddhist temple.

sen.j: （寺号については後述）
sen.e: (Its jigo is described below.)

sen.e: (Its jigo is described below.)

sen.j: 本尊は如意輪観音。
sen.e: Its honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Nyoirin Kannon (the Bodhisattva of Compassion).
Its honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Nyoirin Kannon (the Bodhisattva of Compassion).
Its honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Nyoirin Kannon (the Bodhisattva of Compassion).

sen.j: 西国三十三箇所第7番札所。
sen.e: it is the 7th fudasho (temples where amulets are collected) of Saigoku Sanjusankasho (the 33 temples that are visited during the Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage).
It is the 7th fudasho (temples where amulets are collected) of Saigoku Sanjusankasho (the 33 temples that are visited during the Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage).

sen.j: 創建時期は不明だが、天武天皇の皇子で27歳で早世した草壁皇子の住んだ岡宮の跡に義淵僧正が創建したとされる。
sen.e: It is not known when it was founded, but Gien Sojo is believed to have founded it on the remain of Okanomiya resided by Prince Kusakabe, who was a prince of Emperor Tenmu and died at an early age of 27.

It is not known when it was founded, but Gien Sojo is believed to have founded it on the remain of Okanomiya Palace resided by Prince Kusakabe, who was a prince of Emperor Tenmu and died at an early age of 27.

It is not known when it was founded, but Gien Sojo is believed to have founded it on the remain of Okanomiya Palace resided by Prince Kusakabe, who was a prince of Emperor Tenmu and died at the age of 27.
sen.cmt: at an early age of 27→at the age of 27

sen.j: 寺の西に隣接する治田神社（はるたじんじゃ）境内からは奈良時代前期にさかのぼる古瓦が発掘されている。
sen.e: Old roof-tiles dated back to the early Nara period were excavated at the precinct of Haruta Jinja Shrine, which faces in the west of the temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Old roof-tiles dated back to the early Nara period were excavated at the precincts of Haruta-jinja Shrine, which stands on the west of the temple.
sen.cmt: Haruta-jinja Shrine, which stands on the west of the temple.としました。
sen.e: Old roof-tiles dated back to the early Nara period were excavated at the precincts of Haruta-jinja Shrine, which stands on the west of the temple.

sen.j: 創建当時の岡寺は現在の治田神社の位置にあったものと推定されている。
sen.e: This suggests that Oka-dera Temple, when founded, was located at the place where Haruta Jinja Shrine now stands.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: This suggests that Oka-dera Temple was originally located at the place where Haruta-jinja Shrine now stands.
sen.cmt: was originally located Haruta-jinja Shrineとしました。
sen.e: This suggests that Oka-dera Temple was originally located at the place where Haruta-jinja Shrine now stands.

sen.j: 2005年に国の史跡に指定された。
sen.e: It was designated as a national historical site in 2005.
It was designated as a national historical site in 2005.
It was designated as a national historical site in 2005.

sen.j: 現在では真言宗豊山派の寺院だが、義淵僧正は日本の法相宗の祖である。
sen.e: It is now a temple of Shingo sect Buzan school, but Gien Sojo is the founder of the Dharma Characteristics (Hosso) school of Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is now a temple of the Shingo sect Buzan school, but a high Buddhist priest, Gien Sojo was the founder of the Dharma Characteristics (Hosso) school of Japan.
sen.cmt: the Shingo sect Buzan school,a high Buddhist priest, Gien Sojo wasとしました。
sen.e: It is now a temple of the Shingo sect Buzan school, but a high Buddhist priest, Gien Sojo was the founder of the Dharma Characteristics (Hosso) school of Japan.

sen.j: その門下には東大寺創建に関わった良弁や行基などがいた。
sen.e: His disciples included Roben and Gyoki who took part in the foundation of Todai-ji Temple.

sen.j: 義淵僧正が法相宗の祖とされていたため、江戸時代までは興福寺の末寺であった。
sen.e: It had been a branch temple of Kofuku-ji Temple until the Edo period because Gien Sojo is the founder of the Dharma Characteristics (Hosso) school of Japan.

sen.j: 江戸時代以降は長谷寺の末寺となった。
sen.e: It became a branch temple of Hase-dera Temple in and after Edo period.

sen.j: 「岡寺」は地名に由来する寺号、「龍蓋寺」は法号である。
sen.e: "Oka-dera Temple" is a jigo coming from the place-name, while "Ryugai-ji Temple" is a hogo (a Buddhist name).

sen.j: 如意輪観音像は6臂の坐像に表わすものが多いが、本像は石山寺本尊などと同様の2臂像である。
sen.e: A Nyoirin kannon zo (a painting of Nyoirin Kannon statue) is commonly expressed as a sitting statue having six arms, but this statue, like a principal image statue of Ishiyama-dera Temple, has two arms.

sen.j: 頭部は造像当初のものを残すが、体部は補修が多い。
